Thankfully at this point in our entrepreneurial pursuits we are able to say that we have been punched in the mouth before!  For that reason alone we are sure to give the process a little bit more runway. We realize that there is always the possibility of a delay, but having production experience with our factory partner beforehand helps in mitigating that possibility as much as possible. Our commitment is to keep our backers informed every step of the way with messages and pictures and most certainly give a heads up if we anticipate any delays in fulfillment. We want this journey to be as real and exciting for our backers as it is for us. We really hope that you decide to be a part of the Michoud & Irish foundational family!

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone has the need for one of our beautiful watches or maybe even the ability to participate at this time but we could still use your support. We would greatly appreciate you passing this along to anyone that you think may be interested.  Put the Indiegogo share tools to work:-)

story:
SERMAN BRANDS 5.0 patent pending, a 21st century blend of organization and style compacted into one minimalist wallet. With attention to detail each wallet was crafted to fit your desired lifestyle. Whether it's a trip overseas or a day in the office its the wallet for YOU!

 SERMAN BRANDS 5.0 Had the honor of being featured in GQ. 

So sleek, so slim,! 

 A twist to your everyday wallet the 5.0 adds flavor to your personal unique style. Dress it up or dress it down you will still feel put together.

Problem: Identity Theft is at All Time High. The Secret to Keeping Your Data Safe! Unless properly shielded, your card-based data is readily available when any active reader is in range!  

Solution: SERMAN BRANDS 5.0 is equipped with RFID Blocking technology. The Best Way to Protect Your Smart Cards from unwanted capture of data from your:

• Credit or Debit (for example: MC PayPass, VISA PayWave, AMEX expresspay, INTERAC Flash, etc.)

•Driver's license  

•Protects against access by NFC-equipped Smartphones

The RFID lining does not shield against some cards that operate at low frequencies of 125 kHz like hotel key cards, employee ID Badges, transit passes etc.

Risks and challenges

SERMANBRANDS originated in a small town of California as Dad and the eldest son had a vision to create a family business. All aspects of this Kickstarter 5.0 project; from wallet design, creative design, pictures, and videos, were created exclusively by members of the SERMAN family.

After long dedicated work days they join the rest of the family for European originated dishes as Mama busily feeds nine children as well as encourages and blesses the Serman Brands team. Together the family supports their passions and keeps this dream in their prayers.

Risks and challenges

We value you, our supporters, and value our project.

We worked closely with our trusted supplier who helped us bring our last 3 Kickstarter project to life, in which we successfully delivered all the rewards/products. Our backers were satisfied!

Many years of experience has taught our team that although we are prepared in every aspect, unexpected events may come up that are not in our control. We ensure you, that we will take the necessary measures to directly communicate with you if any issue on shipping or production arises.

story:
AVAILABLE WITH 2 MOVEMENT OPTIONS and 14 Dial Colors!

  • Miyota 9015 24 Jewel Automatic OR
  • Swiss Made ETA 2824-2
  •  Limited Edition.  Each Pieces Will Individualized Serial #

Abalone Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

KEY FEATURES

  • Milled Clasp ( we have decided to upgrade for production versus stamped Prototypes)  see pictures further down on this page
  • Ceramic Bezel
  • 300M Water Resistance
  • Helium Escape Valve
  • 2.5 mm Sapphire Crystal with Anti Reflective Coating
  • BWG9 Luminous on Bezel, Hands and Hour Markers
  • 2 Movement Options Available: Swiss Made ETA 2824-2 Automatic or 24 Jewel Miyota 9015 Automatic Movement 
  • Limited Edition 1769 Pieces With Each Numbered xxxx/1769
  • 316L Steel Case and Bracelet
  • Screw Down Crown
  • Relief Screw Down Case Back
  • 41mm Case Diameter, 45mm Bezel Edge to Crown
  • 47.5mm Lug End to Lug End
  • 20mm Bracelet Width Tapers to 17.5mm at clasp
  • Double Locking High Quality Clasp (milled, not stamped)
  • Screws in Bracelet/Not Push Pins
  • Watertight ABS box with Free Strap and More extras!
  • 4 Year Warranty on Movement
  • This is a quality made watch weighing  5.7 ounces (Approx. 162 grams)  

Blue Mother of Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

 

STORY BEHIND FIRST WATCH SERIES

When Captain James Cook – generally regarded as one of history’s most ambitious explorers – came upon New Zealand in 1769, he met the Maori people and was inspired by their durability and strength. His ship at the time was called the HMS Endeavor – an apt name for an adventurer’s ship. Captain Cook became so impressed with Maori people that he would return to New Zealand three times, often commenting on the resolve and dedication of the people who lived there.  The Aquacy™ Logo is inspired by the Hei Matau, an at least 2000 year old symbol.  Each Aquacy™ 1769 has on the dial the 1769 in distressed font reproduction from James Cook's original map of New Zealand.  Each watch will be individually numbered (Limited to 1769 Pieces) with a ceramic bezel insert among other highly desirable features.   

Black Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Red Sunburst Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Orange Sunburst Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Black Mother of Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

White Mother of Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

White Mother of Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Blue Sunburst Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Double Locking folding clasp(Now upgraded to milled at not charge!)

Black Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Red Sunburst Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Black Mother of Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Blue Mother or Pearl Dial With Black Ceramic Bezel

Also Available with ETA 2824-2 Swiss Made Movement

ETA 2824-2 Specs:

  • Hours, minutes, sweep second
  • 38 Hour Power Reserve
  • Self-winding mechanism with ball bearing
  • Date in window, corrector
  • Stop second device
  • Regulator system ETACHRON and regulator corrector
  • 28.800 vibrations per hour; 4 Hz
  • 25 Jewels
  • Size: 11.5 '''
  • Height 4,60 mm
  • Diameter 25,60 mm

 

 

 

 

FACTORY TOUR

 At Aquacy Dive Watches we take pride in our quality. Scroll down to see the entire factory tour complete with pictures and video. See how your watch was made. Mostly handcrafted and assembled. 

The Case

It Starts with the case. Cut form a single block of 316L Stainless Steel the case is machined, lathed, drilled and polished. Each case then goes through a quality control check where specs are checked to ensure perfection. 

 

The Dial

The dial is assembled. Your dial is handcrafted by a skilled artisan whom attaches each part with precision.  

A watchmaker with 15 years experience assembles your Aquacy Dive Watch.

The bezel with ceramic insert is attached to the precision machined case. The dial is the attached the movement. The hands are then precisely placed on the dial. The movement is installed into the case. The crown is attached. The screw down case back with double seal is screwed down onto the case to ensure a water tight seal. Finally the bracelet is attached. The watch then goes through a final quality control to ensure functionality and timekeeping.

Dial is Attached to Miyota (Citizen) 9015 24 Jewel Automatic Movement 

Hands Are Attached To The Dial

Movement Is Installed Into The Case

Crown Is Attached

Caseback Is Installed

story:
Summary

My name is David and I am the founder of Haydn. I am coming from a background of Finance, but I also have a strong passion for art and design. Combining business and design allowed me to have the best of both worlds. And now, I have the chance to live my passion to the fullest. with Haydn!

At Haydn, we are fully committed to the satisfaction of our customers. We will always make sure your experience with our brand lives up to our very high standards, starting with the look of our products, the warranty, and the return policy. We are very confident that you will love our products and that they will become staple in your wardrobe. Our collection will showcase your individuality and style.

Our products are currently available online at www.haydn.ca, but we have handpicked our four (4) bestsellers for you guys at indigogo to make you discover our brand and buy our products at awesome discounted prices!

Why crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding is a great way to get a community behind a brand and offers a great window of visibility!

We have just closed out a very successful Kickstarter campaign and would like to keep this awesome momentum going with you guys from the Indigogo community!

As a startup company who aims to thrive on a very competitive global market, we need to purchase our opening inventory, get our working capital straight and have some funds to position ourselves with some marketing initiatives.

You can help us and get started and buy some elegant quality Haydn products, all at once! 

The Impact

The Haydn brand is very committed to giving back to the community. We are very proud to have partnered with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation of Canada and with each Haydn product purchased, an amount will go directly to the Foundation.

story:
Who Are We?

It started with a quirky conversation about a random topic: "What are collective nouns?" In this conversation, our founder Jesus Garcia learned that just like we refer to a group of fish "school" and a group of sheep "herd", there are some interesting - dare we say funny - names for groups of species. One of these collective nouns lit an idea in his mind: "band of gorillas". As he pictured a rock band of gorillas playing instruments, Jesus thought "That would look good on a t-shirt".

Critter Collective Crews - or 3C for short - is taking collective nouns and making them into fun designs that will be on display on our great quality products. As a tiny company (of humans, not parrots) in San Francisco, we will ensure our best efforts to provide our customers from all over with the best experience with our products.

 

We live by the following values:

Community

We are all one community and as a community, we ensure to do our best in giving everyone the best experience - whether as a customer, partner, or just a fan!

We also care about our communities outside of the 3C community and hope to give our support to those in need when we can.

Trust

We don't want to let you down. That is why we will do our best to answer any inquiries you may have with your experience with us (purchases, communication, etc.).

We also want to make sure you are notified of anything from our end, so connect with us through our newsletter (coming soon) or our social media platforms: @posts3c on Facebook, @tweets3c on Twitter, or @pictures3c on Instagram.

Fun

We love fun (who doesn't?). We have lots of fun creating these designs and products and want everyone to have fun with them too. Stay connected with us to be in the know when we announce new designs and/or products.

 

We Need Your Help!

We are in the early stages of our company, so we need some help in getting things moving. We are looking to raise $10000 this winter to cover initial costs for expenses such as:

 

Tooling - We need certain software and other tools to help us create great designs and build a seamless shopping experience online

Quality Assurance Samples - We want to ensure we provide you with the best quality products and to do so we need to test them out ourselves

Employment / Compensation - We need help from many people to make our launch as successful as possible and we want to thank these people with what we can! Your support would help us provide compensation to everybody who is working with us to launch our brand and products.

 

We also want to thank you for your support! We are providing "Raft of Otters" t-shirts from our special edition Give Love Collection as tokens of our appreciation to those who donate $75+. These t-shirts will not be offered for sale in our store because we want to make this collection extra special for you.

We also need your help getting the word out about us, so please roar about us to all your friends! Follow us and share @posts3c on Facebook, @tweets3c on Twitter, and @pictures3c on Instagram. We are excited to build our community and share with you all that's to come real soon.

story:
• This campaign will allow us to launch our #1for1 initiative by raising  the capital needed to reduce wholesale costs. What is our #1for1 initiative? With every hat you purchase we will be able to pay for someone’s counselling or therapy session who would otherwise not be able to afford it.
  • This campaign will help set us up for growth and the long term success of WIRTH.

WIRTH Hats is a social venture where our profits go towards supporting mental health initiatives. WIRTH Hats is a tribute to loved and lost friends. It’s a commitment to conversation and openness. We aim to break down barriers and promote open dialogue about mental health. The goal of WIRTH Hats is simple: we want everyone in the world to know they are not alone, and we believe owning a WIRTH Hat will help with that. By wearing a WIRTH Hat, we invite you to be open, to listen and to always remember - You’re #WirthIt.” 

 

The WIRTH Hats Story

On July 11th, 2014 I received a message from a fellow classmate: “I hate to be the one who announces this news but I think you should know… Jakob Wirth is no longer with us. He died a few days ago, in Turkey.”

Three months prior: my friend and classmate Jakob Wirth shared with me that he wanted to start a hat company. At the time, Jakob and I were in a masters program called Organizational Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the Copenhagen Business School. There wasn’t a class that went by where we didn’t hear the word innovation, and any idea that came out of our mouths felt like it needed to be unique, in some way.

When Jakob shared with me that he wanted to start a hat company, it was different. “I love hats, plain and simple. I want to make hats that people are excited to put on every morning,” he told me. I thought about suggesting some sort of x-ray-measuring-brain-wave feature to go along with it – as a way to check the ‘unique’ box – but I bit my tongue. He just wanted to make hats – nice hats that people would be excited to wear. How could anyone argue with that? I also loved a good hat.

Over the coming months, Jakob and I talked about his hat company a lot. I told him that I thought his last name, Wirth, would make a great company name, and that there were so many opportunities to play on those words. He hummed and hawed about it – while he liked the idea, he thought it seemed a little arrogant for his liking.

That summer, I left Copenhagen to go back home to Vancouver, Canada.

That summer, Jakob took his life.

Seeing those words written today still makes my stomach drop. I remember sitting back and staring at the wall, tears streaming from my face, while hundreds of thoughts circled my mind.

For the next few weeks, every time I saw a hat, I thought of Jakob’s hat company. I thought of WIRTH. I felt there would be no better way to honour my friend than for Jakob to have his hat company brought to life.

With the help of a friend, I started down that road. In February 2015, I returned to Copenhagen with 25 WIRTH Hats for Jakob’s family and closest friends. The hats were to honour Jakob’s dream, but more importantly – they were a symbol for the many struggles that lie beyond our view.

The tags on the hats read: “WIRTH Hats are in memory of Jakob Wirth, who passed away last year. Jakob’s dream was to create a hat company that people would love, so here’s toWIRTH Hats. May these hats serve as a reminder that when going through difficult times, there are always people to reach out to, as we are never alone as we sometimes think we are.”

This is where I thought the WIRTH Hats story would end.

It was meant to be a one time thing: for Jakob to have his hat company, and for the hats to be a reminder of the mental health struggles we all experience. I wore my hat whenever I could, and put the tag in my wallet. With that, I bid my friend goodbye and moved back to Vancouver later that year.

Over a year later, in October 2016 my close friend and masters thesis partner, Philipp Altenburg decided to move out to Vancouver. I’ve never spent more time with a single person in my life than with Philipp during our studies. We wrote our thesis together on “How improv theatre can use interpersonal communication skills to improve collaboration.” Philipp loved improv theatre. He could talk about it for hours. There were several occasions when I would have to tell him that most people will likely stop caring about improv after a few minutes – and that this was probably one of the reasons why women would move from sitting beside us when we were out.

For six months, day in and day out, Philipp and I worked together on our thesis. Near the end, we would be spending close to 15 hours a day with each other. And when he moved to Vancouver, Philipp wanted to pursue – you guessed it – improv. Philipp truly believed it could break down barriers to communication, and provide others with so much joy.

After a few months in Vancouver, Philipp was struggling with visa issues, and had to move back to Berlin. We would have weekly Skype calls, where each of us would pick an issue or topic that we found inspiring and discuss it. On one of our morning calls, I asked how he was doing. I expected to hear the usual: “good.” But what came out of his mouth was something different.

“I am struggling a bit. But I’ll be fine,” he said.

He quickly wanted to move onto talking about our weekly topic. Instead, we spent the next hour talking about how he had been struggling with feelings of isolation and depression since his move back to Berlin.

After that call, Philipp and I talked almost every day. He continued to struggle, but never appeared to be in crisis. He talked with other close friends in Berlin too, and was encouraged go talk to a professional, but he said he would when he got a job and could get the costs covered by insurance.

After some time, Philipp seemed to be turning over a new leaf. He found a job and felt like he was beginning to understand what he was going through.

Things seemed optimistic, at least from the outside.

Philipp and I went a few weeks without chatting. I had been away for July 1st, Canada Day weekend and didn’t have cell service for those few days. When I arrived back home, it was late on a Monday and I received a message from another one of Philipp’s best friends.

“Do you have time to talk?” Right away, something didn’t feel right.

I waited anxiously by my computer until he woke up. During that time, I desperately tried to reach out to Philipp, to hear anything at all from him. When my friend called, I knew before he even said the words. I burst into tears and screamed louder than I ever have before.

On July 1st, 2017, Philipp Altenburg took his life.

As I write these words, I still have tears that run down my face.

Philipp’s death shook me to my core. Never in my wildest dreams did I ever imagine he would take his life. Endless questions raced through my mind: How long had he been feeling this way? How deep was his suffering? Had it always been there? Why had I never asked? Did he think he couldn’t tell me? What did I need to do? These are all questions I will never have answers to. I couldn’t believe my friend was gone, but more shocking was how it happened.

Weeks later, a mutual friend of mine and Philipp’s reached out and asked if by any chance I had any more WIRTH Hats. He said he would really love to have one if I did, because it served as a good reminder of the realness of mental health.

That message stayed with me for several months, as both Philipp’s and Jakob’s passing consumed my thoughts alongside the larger epidemic of suicide, and the cultural and societal stigmas that surround it.

I thought of all the times I’d been down and out, feeling alone and isolated – yet never willing or wanting to share. My view of vulnerability was that it was weakness, and why would I burden others with issues of my own? A feeling that may be familiar to many. With all of this, I decided I would put WIRTH Hats into the world again – a symbol for a conversation, a reminder that we need to be more open and vulnerable with each other, and a promise to a friend to make the best hat company I could.

Since the launch of Wirth Hats in May 2018, we’ve hosted pop-ups at Patagonia and Sitka in Vancouver, Banded Peak Brewing in Calgary and Hooha Store in Copenhagen. In just five months, it’s already been a journey filled with amazing, sad, enlightening and eye-opening conversations. We’ve heard stories of people being on a ferry and knocking on stranger’s windows, just to show them they also have a Wirth Hat. Sometimes, I can’t help but wonder how perfect and fitting the name WIRTH is for this cause. Even through the sadness, there’s a part of me that feels like maybe this was Jakob’s gift to the world.

I truly believe that if WIRTH can help even one person, it will all be worth it. You can’t put a price on life, and that’s something I am willing to dedicate mine to.

It’s my dream for everyone in the world to own a WIRTH Hat, but more importantly, I want everyone to own what a WIRTH Hat represents. If we can get to a point where we treat our mental health the same as we do our physical health, I know the world will be in a much better place.

When we hold things in, they can come out in other ways. In both Jakob and Phillip’s case, neither sought professional help – which is painful to think about now – but unfortunately, it’s a common trend.

We must break this taboo. We all need someone to talk to who isn’t just a friend – an impartial professional who is there to listen, to let us know we are not alone and to help us make sense of what we are feeling and experiencing. This goes for when we are on top of the world, hitting rock bottom, and everywhere in between.

We have work to do to make counselling and therapy accessible for all, but more importantly, making it normal for all.

Forty years ago, if someone went for a run, it wasn’t normal. How things can change. My hope is that going to see a counsellor, therapist, psychiatrist, etc etc, will be the new normal over the next 10 years. Hopefully, even sooner than that.

I have one last story to share from our early journey, during our first pop-up shop at Patagonia, I was sharing the WIRTH story with a young man. As I was speaking, he was closely examining all the details of the hats. Then, all of a sudden, he stopped me mid-sentence and said, “Dude, I get it. It’s a hug for your head! Say no more!”. He then carried on to purchase several WIRTH Hats for his friends and family.

Thank you for reading our story!

Yours,

The WIRTH Hats Team

Ben, Alexa, Natalie, Alexandra, Zafira, Aili, Sarah, Julie, Josh, Jay, Adam, Kody, Joe, Michael, Anthony, Alexander & Chad

Please follow us and share your story!

https://www.facebook.com/WirthHats/
https://twitter.com/WirthHats
https://www.instagram.com/wirthhats
https://www.linkedin.com/company/wirthhats/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCN9rOnxwwNLi_Rxs0vLer_Q

WIRTH Hats, a symbol for conversation. #hugforyourhead #wirthit
story_txt:
This campaign will allow us to launch our #1for1 initiative by raising  the capital needed to reduce wholesale costs. What is our #1for1 initiative? With every hat you purchase we will be able to pay for someone’s counselling or therapy session who would otherwise not be able to afford it.
This campaign will help set us up for growth and the long term success of WIRTH.
WIRTH Hats is a social venture where our profits go towards supporting mental health initiatives. WIRTH Hats is a tribute to loved and lost friends. It’s a commitment to conversation and openness. We aim to break down barriers and promote open dialogue about mental health. The goal of WIRTH Hats is simple: we want everyone in the world to know they are not alone, and we believe owning a WIRTH Hat will help with that. By wearing a WIRTH Hat, we invite you to be open, to listen and to always remember - You’re #WirthIt.”  The WIRTH Hats StoryOn July 11th, 2014 I received a message from a fellow classmate: “I hate to be the one who announces this news but I think you should know… Jakob Wirth is no longer with us. He died a few days ago, in Turkey.”Three months prior: my friend and classmate Jakob Wirth shared with me that he wanted to start a hat company. At the time, Jakob and I were in a masters program called Organizational Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the Copenhagen Business School. There wasn’t a class that went by where we didn’t hear the word innovation, and any idea that came out of our mouths felt like it needed to be unique, in some way.When Jakob shared with me that he wanted to start a hat company, it was different. “I love hats, plain and simple. I want to make hats that people are excited to put on every morning,” he told me. I thought about suggesting some sort of x-ray-measuring-brain-wave feature to go along with it – as a way to check the ‘unique’ box – but I bit my tongue. He just wanted to make hats – nice hats that people would be excited to wear. How could anyone argue with that? I also loved a good hat.Over the coming months, Jakob and I talked about his hat company a lot. I told him that I thought his last name, Wirth, would make a great company name, and that there were so many opportunities to play on those words. He hummed and hawed about it – while he liked the idea, he thought it seemed a little arrogant for his liking.That summer, I left Copenhagen to go back home to Vancouver, Canada.That summer, Jakob took his life.Seeing those words written today still makes my stomach drop. I remember sitting back and staring at the wall, tears streaming from my face, while hundreds of thoughts circled my mind.For the next few weeks, every time I saw a hat, I thought of Jakob’s hat company. I thought of WIRTH. I felt there would be no better way to honour my friend than for Jakob to have his hat company brought to life.With the help of a friend, I started down that road. In February 2015, I returned to Copenhagen with 25 WIRTH Hats for Jakob’s family and closest friends. The hats were to honour Jakob’s dream, but more importantly – they were a symbol for the many struggles that lie beyond our view.The tags on the hats read: “WIRTH Hats are in memory of Jakob Wirth, who passed away last year. Jakob’s dream was to create a hat company that people would love, so here’s toWIRTH Hats. May these hats serve as a reminder that when going through difficult times, there are always people to reach out to, as we are never alone as we sometimes think we are.”This is where I thought the WIRTH Hats story would end.It was meant to be a one time thing: for Jakob to have his hat company, and for the hats to be a reminder of the mental health struggles we all experience. I wore my hat whenever I could, and put the tag in my wallet. With that, I bid my friend goodbye and moved back to Vancouver later that year.Over a year later, in October 2016 my close friend and masters thesis partner, Philipp Altenburg decided to move out to Vancouver. I’ve never spent more time with a single person in my life than with Philipp during our studies. We wrote our thesis together on “How improv theatre can use interpersonal communication skills to improve collaboration.” Philipp loved improv theatre. He could talk about it for hours. There were several occasions when I would have to tell him that most people will likely stop caring about improv after a few minutes – and that this was probably one of the reasons why women would move from sitting beside us when we were out.For six months, day in and day out, Philipp and I worked together on our thesis. Near the end, we would be spending close to 15 hours a day with each other. And when he moved to Vancouver, Philipp wanted to pursue – you guessed it – improv. Philipp truly believed it could break down barriers to communication, and provide others with so much joy.After a few months in Vancouver, Philipp was struggling with visa issues, and had to move back to Berlin. We would have weekly Skype calls, where each of us would pick an issue or topic that we found inspiring and discuss it. On one of our morning calls, I asked how he was doing. I expected to hear the usual: “good.” But what came out of his mouth was something different.“I am struggling a bit. But I’ll be fine,” he said.He quickly wanted to move onto talking about our weekly topic. Instead, we spent the next hour talking about how he had been struggling with feelings of isolation and depression since his move back to Berlin.After that call, Philipp and I talked almost every day. He continued to struggle, but never appeared to be in crisis. He talked with other close friends in Berlin too, and was encouraged go talk to a professional, but he said he would when he got a job and could get the costs covered by insurance.After some time, Philipp seemed to be turning over a new leaf. He found a job and felt like he was beginning to understand what he was going through.Things seemed optimistic, at least from the outside.Philipp and I went a few weeks without chatting. I had been away for July 1st, Canada Day weekend and didn’t have cell service for those few days. When I arrived back home, it was late on a Monday and I received a message from another one of Philipp’s best friends.“Do you have time to talk?” Right away, something didn’t feel right.I waited anxiously by my computer until he woke up. During that time, I desperately tried to reach out to Philipp, to hear anything at all from him. When my friend called, I knew before he even said the words. I burst into tears and screamed louder than I ever have before.On July 1st, 2017, Philipp Altenburg took his life.As I write these words, I still have tears that run down my face.Philipp’s death shook me to my core. Never in my wildest dreams did I ever imagine he would take his life. Endless questions raced through my mind: How long had he been feeling this way? How deep was his suffering? Had it always been there? Why had I never asked? Did he think he couldn’t tell me? What did I need to do? These are all questions I will never have answers to. I couldn’t believe my friend was gone, but more shocking was how it happened.Weeks later, a mutual friend of mine and Philipp’s reached out and asked if by any chance I had any more WIRTH Hats. He said he would really love to have one if I did, because it served as a good reminder of the realness of mental health.That message stayed with me for several months, as both Philipp’s and Jakob’s passing consumed my thoughts alongside the larger epidemic of suicide, and the cultural and societal stigmas that surround it.I thought of all the times I’d been down and out, feeling alone and isolated – yet never willing or wanting to share. My view of vulnerability was that it was weakness, and why would I burden others with issues of my own? A feeling that may be familiar to many. With all of this, I decided I would put WIRTH Hats into the world again – a symbol for a conversation, a reminder that we need to be more open and vulnerable with each other, and a promise to a friend to make the best hat company I could.Since the launch of Wirth Hats in May 2018, we’ve hosted pop-ups at Patagonia and Sitka in Vancouver, Banded Peak Brewing in Calgary and Hooha Store in Copenhagen. In just five months, it’s already been a journey filled with amazing, sad, enlightening and eye-opening conversations. We’ve heard stories of people being on a ferry and knocking on stranger’s windows, just to show them they also have a Wirth Hat. Sometimes, I can’t help but wonder how perfect and fitting the name WIRTH is for this cause. Even through the sadness, there’s a part of me that feels like maybe this was Jakob’s gift to the world.I truly believe that if WIRTH can help even one person, it will all be worth it. You can’t put a price on life, and that’s something I am willing to dedicate mine to.It’s my dream for everyone in the world to own a WIRTH Hat, but more importantly, I want everyone to own what a WIRTH Hat represents. If we can get to a point where we treat our mental health the same as we do our physical health, I know the world will be in a much better place.When we hold things in, they can come out in other ways. In both Jakob and Phillip’s case, neither sought professional help – which is painful to think about now – but unfortunately, it’s a common trend.We must break this taboo. We all need someone to talk to who isn’t just a friend – an impartial professional who is there to listen, to let us know we are not alone and to help us make sense of what we are feeling and experiencing. This goes for when we are on top of the world, hitting rock bottom, and everywhere in between.We have work to do to make counselling and therapy accessible for all, but more importantly, making it normal for all.Forty years ago, if someone went for a run, it wasn’t normal. How things can change. My hope is that going to see a counsellor, therapist, psychiatrist, etc etc, will be the new normal over the next 10 years. Hopefully, even sooner than that.I have one last story to share from our early journey, during our first pop-up shop at Patagonia, I was sharing the WIRTH story with a young man. As I was speaking, he was closely examining all the details of the hats. Then, all of a sudden, he stopped me mid-sentence and said, “Dude, I get it. It’s a hug for your head! Say no more!”. He then carried on to purchase several WIRTH Hats for his friends and family.Thank you for reading our story!Yours,The WIRTH Hats TeamBen, Alexa, Natalie, Alexandra, Zafira, Aili, Sarah, Julie, Josh, Jay, Adam, Kody, Joe, Michael, Anthony, Alexander & ChadPlease follow us and share your story!https://www.facebook.com/WirthHats/https://twitter.com/WirthHatshttps://www.instagram.com/wirthhatshttps://www.linkedin.com/company/wirthhats/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCN9rOnxwwNLi_Rxs0vLer_QWIRTH Hats, a symbol for conversation. #hugforyourhead #wirthit

story:
Check out the work of our friends at OneTreePlanted.org and their IG: @OneTreePlanted

100% AIRTIGHT. 100% WATERPROOF. 100% RELIABLE.

Don't worry about water. It doesn't get a hold on the AVO, because it's made out of extremely waterproof, lightweight and strong fabrics.

See for yourself!

 

 

MULTIPLE CLOSURE OPTIONS.

The AVO supports multiple closures. The roll-top closure makes sure  everything you carry stays dry. Roll it three times and you can even have a swim. Yes, we're not kidding. In a hurry? Flap it up. Can't be bothered? Just buckle up and off you go. 

 

HIGH-TECH SEAMS. 

A high-tech construction is at the core of this bag. Thanks to the technology of High-Frequency Welding, we managed to create a backpack with indestructible seams. Not only do they scream NO to water, but they also give the bag a never-before-seen sleek look.  

 

REINFORCED BOTTOM. 

We added some extra padding to the bottom. Because we care about your precious stuff. 

 

WATER-RESISTANT OUTER POCKETS.  

The AVO features two outer pockets. Not just regular pockets. Water-resistant pockets. One in the back. Hidden, yet easily accessible for you. One in the front. Because it looks cool like that. 

 

 

ERGO-SHAPED SHOULDER STRAPS.  

The straps are engineered and shaped to guarantee maximum comfort. Period. You don't expect any less, right? 

 

CLIMATE CONTROLLED.  

The muscle-shaped backpanel supports your back-muscles there where needed. Padded with higher density foam to ensure maximum comfort. The backpanel features a central air flow channel to keep your back ventilated at all times. 

 

INTEGRATED BOTTLE POCKET.  

Who thought a bottle pocket could look so good on a backpack? We did.  

REFLECTIVE TRIMS.  

Stand out from the crowd: that's what we go for. It's important to be seen, day or night. Therefore we have added subtle, but present, reflective trims to the AVO. You won't notice them during day, but you will be noticed at night.  

MINIMALIST INTERIOR. 

The AVO pack features a minimalist interior. Just enough to organize the essentials. Let's be real: who needs more? SAY YES TO MORE CARRY SPACE!

 

REMOVABLE LAPTOP SLEEVE. 

We integrated a removable laptop sleeve. Traveling tech-free? Remove it and create more carry-space in your AVO. Traveling super-light? Remove it, and swing it on your back. 

Did we say sleeve? Sorry. We meant backpack.

IMPORTANT NOTE: The Carry Sleeve will only be available in black color. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: The Carry Sleeve will only be available in black color. 

 

 

Why DEW? Are DEW backpacks better than others? Not necessarily... Wait, what? ?

There are many great backpack suppliers out there - and we respect them a lot. But we try to give our bags a unique touch... a touch that makes our packs stand out from the crowd. 

Our collection of packs consists out of quality waterproof backpacks with urban aesthetics. They are the outcome of an iterative, thoughtful design process in collaboration with real users. That's how we roll.

story:
Please note that if you decide to back our campaign to help us, Medecins Sans Frontières and ofcourse yourself with some fresh streetwear, you are guaranteeing yourself of receiving your products you have paid for even if we will not match our €4000 goal on Indiegogo.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to email us on mizunashi.info@gmail.com. If you are having problems with payments via Indiegogo it is also possible to place an order via mizunashi.info@gmail.com. We are more than happy to help you.  

MIZU NASHI

Mizu Nashi is a streetwear brand founded in February 2020 by three young entrepreneurs who find their roots in various parts of the world, coming together in the Netherlands. Trying to make an impact on society we have created Mizu Nashi, durable streetwear inspired by society. 


 

The original idea behind the brand was to make sustainable rainwear and with that in mind it may be helpful to know that Mizu Nashi means 'No Water' in Japanese. Unfortunately we were forced to change course due to the COVID-19 outbreak worldwide together with all the factories which were shut down as a result. From that moment on we have been focussing on making regular streetwear apparel with different social themes each collection, as displayed in our Indiegogo campaign.

The Ode to Healthcare collection

The first collection is inspired by the current worldwide COVID-19 crisis where we focus on healthcare. In this collection the colour palette is inspired by the colours that healthcare workers from all over the world are wearing in hospitals. We use blue, white and grey in our designs. It may not be forgotten that healthcare workers put their life on the line to help others in need for the past six months, today and in the future, especially during this COVID-19 crisis for the months or maybe years ahead. Healthcare workers are always there for their patients, work hard and deserve acknowledgement for what they do. That's why we created the Ode to Healthcare collection. Mizu Nashi donates 15% of the profits from the Ode to Healthcare collection to Medecins sans frontieres (https://www.msf.org/). For those who don't know this organization, Medecins sans frontieres is an organization that brings medical humanitarian assistance to victims of conflict, natural disasters, epidemics or healthcare exclusion. The work they do is of huge importance and we are glad to support their projects.

 

The Ode to Healthcare collection contains the Care Package which consists of one or more items by your choice:
- Liner vest - this is a vest which can be worn independently as an extra layer over your longsleeve, t-shirt or hoodie. The vest is made out of Taslan. Taslan is a modern, high-tech, woven polyester fabric which is water repellent.
We are planning to create a rain jacket later this year, the liner vest can be zipped into this rain jacket which makes it a warm, not seasonal rain jacket.
- Hoodie - The hoodie is very comfy and made out of 100% cotton. 
- Longsleeve - The longsleeve is made out of 100% cotton with a comfortable regular fit.
- T-shirt - The T-shirt is also made out of 100% cotton with a comfortable regular fit.
- Facemask - The Mizu Nashi facemask is a non-medical facemask which is made out of Taslan and is water repellent. The facemask comes with a slit in which you can slot a filter in.

From here on we want make a greater story and start building the Mizu Nashi community through all our channels with you, the most important character in the story. We are aiming for sustainable business operations in 2021 where we will produce our apparel from our very own fabrics. This will require development and development is a valuable thing. This is why we need your help by contributing to our campaign.

We want to take you on our journey through the coming years, will you hop on the bus with us? 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down real quick and clear to you. Our cost estimate amounts to roughly €4000. Our biggest expense will be the protection of our brandname which will cost up to €2000 for 10 years. The rest of it will go to the costs of production, marketing, development, patterns, photographers and videographers, web domain and maintenance for example.

For the backers of our campaign we have created a few very exclusive perks, consisting of....:

Perk 1:
Facemask

Perk 2:
Facemask (for free)
T-shirt

Perk 3:
Facemask (for free)
Longsleeve

Perk 4:
Facemask (for free)
Hoodie

Perk 5:
Facemask (for free)
Longsleeve
T-shirt

Perk 5:
Facemask (for free)
Hoodie
Longsleeve

Perk 7:
Facemask (for free)
Liner vest

Perk 8:
Facemask (for free)
Vest
Longsleeve
T-shirt

Perk 9:
2x Facemask (for free)
Vest
Hoodie
Longsleeve
T-shirt

As you can see there's basically something for everyone, so we're hoping there's also something for you!

 

What if we do not reach our goal?
When we do not reach our goal, we will still invest everything we did receive in the aforementioned aspects. All the backers will get the products they have paid for.

The Impact

We at Mizu Nashi believe that the fashion industry has the power to make a huge impact and change things for the better for everyone involved. To make the industry but also the world more sustainable, fair, equal and more aware of certain topics. To educate people but also to learn from the people. With our contribution to charity organizations matching with our collection themes we want to support those organizations that put all their work and effort in reaching their goals concerning these important topics, their work may not be underestimated.
Your contribution can make a difference and it gives us the opportunity to continue with our mission: to keep creating collections and awareness while supporting charities and supporting everyone affected by social issues.  

 

Risks and challenges

First of all, we are not looking for a big fortune through this Indiegogo campaign. We would love to receive enough support to continue with the growth of Mizu Nashi and to cover the costs including production, marketing and shipping. In the future we are planning on moving our production from the Netherlands to Portugal and to use our own fabrics which will be sustainable and ofcourse of high quality.


 

By contributing from behind your desktop or laptop you may experience difficulties with payment options, if you only get to choose payment via Credit card try a contribution via your smartphone with Apple Pay or Google Pay.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know there's a chance that you don't want to or can't contribute to our campaign and that's okay, we get that. Moreover, we can't and certainly don't want to force you into things you don't want to do.

BUT... We can always ask you for a favor! If you do like our campaign you can still help us a lot by sharing our Indiegogo campaign or social media channels through your own channels:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mizunashi_official/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Mizu-Nashi-10361238793...

We love the concept of sharing love, we hope you do to!

Team Mizu Nashi

 

Ps. 
To get to know the people you are helping with their crowdfunding, this is us:

Davy De la Paz, student at the Amsterdam Fashion Institute, the Netherlands.

 

Tarik Baghdadi, student at the Amsterdam Fashion Institute, the Netherlands.

Willem Meijer, student Communication at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences.

The rest of it will go to the costs of production, marketing, development, patterns, photographers and videographers, web domain and maintenance for example.For the backers of our campaign we have created a few very exclusive perks, consisting of....:Perk 1:FacemaskPerk 2:Facemask (for free)T-shirtPerk 3:Facemask (for free)LongsleevePerk 4:Facemask (for free)HoodiePerk 5:Facemask (for free)LongsleeveT-shirtPerk 5:Facemask (for free)HoodieLongsleevePerk 7:Facemask (for free)Liner vestPerk 8:Facemask (for free)VestLongsleeveT-shirtPerk 9:2x Facemask (for free)VestHoodieLongsleeveT-shirtAs you can see there's basically something for everyone, so we're hoping there's also something for you! What if we do not reach our goal?When we do not reach our goal, we will still invest everything we did receive in the aforementioned aspects. All the backers will get the products they have paid for.The ImpactWe at Mizu Nashi believe that the fashion industry has the power to make a huge impact and change things for the better for everyone involved. To make the industry but also the world more sustainable, fair, equal and more aware of certain topics. To educate people but also to learn from the people. With our contribution to charity organizations matching with our collection themes we want to support those organizations that put all their work and effort in reaching their goals concerning these important topics, their work may not be underestimated.Your contribution can make a difference and it gives us the opportunity to continue with our mission: to keep creating collections and awareness while supporting charities and supporting everyone affected by social issues.   Risks and challengesFirst of all, we are not looking for a big fortune through this Indiegogo campaign. We would love to receive enough support to continue with the growth of Mizu Nashi and to cover the costs including production, marketing and shipping. In the future we are planning on moving our production from the Netherlands to Portugal and to use our own fabrics which will be sustainable and ofcourse of high quality. By contributing from behind your desktop or laptop you may experience difficulties with payment options, if you only get to choose payment via Credit card try a contribution via your smartphone with Apple Pay or Google Pay.Other Ways You Can HelpWe know there's a chance that you don't want to or can't contribute to our campaign and that's okay, we get that. Moreover, we can't and certainly don't want to force you into things you don't want to do.BUT... We can always ask you for a favor! If you do like our campaign you can still help us a lot by sharing our Indiegogo campaign or social media channels through your own channels:Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mizunashi_official/Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Mizu-Nashi-10361238793...We love the concept of sharing love, we hope you do to!Team Mizu Nashi Ps. To get to know the people you are helping with their crowdfunding, this is us:Davy De la Paz, student at the Amsterdam Fashion Institute, the Netherlands. Tarik Baghdadi, student at the Amsterdam Fashion Institute, the Netherlands.Willem Meijer, student Communication at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences.

story:
Meet Zeitgeist “H1”, a highly aesthetically bronze diving watch, keeping you company in the depths of the sea for generations.

As the veteran used to design and manufacture for other verrrry successful kickstarters, our sole purpose is to create ideal watch and ensuring affordability whilst incorporating high-end components and premium craftsmanship in the watch.

 Helium Valve ~ for professional diver

See more in FAQ

In order to achieve thinner profile, we design the best watch structure with equipped with thinnest movement.

This allows the watch to be nicely tucked under the cuffs, making it an ideal choice to be worn daily.

At the watch movement production line in Japan, Miyota 9039 is known to be best Japanese movement.

For the choice of movement, if you value quality, technology, and reliability, then Miyota caliber 9039 is definitely your best choice.

If you have an aesthetic preference for structure and materials of movement over otherwise, ETA 2801-2 is definitely your best choice.

ETA 2801-2, a Swiss-made manual winding movement, is even considered as the best of its kind.

From the way the metals are being cut, to the colour of the jewels, every detail is being meticulously developed during the design and production process.

Of course, we believe that the manual winding feature will also provide you with additional fun.

This is Cool, Right?

32 steps machine process is applie  

The watch “H1”is as exquisite as its movement, allowing you to always feel the charm of mechanical precision.

boasting its brightness and durability, C3 (SuperLuminova)and BGW9, the best fluorescent materials is applied.

Filled up instead coating.

The lume will be brighter and longer lasting.

While most companies provide a 2-year warranty for the watch’s movement, we will be providing a 5-year warranty special for kickstarters. Any repairs or replacement of affected parts will be at minimal downtime.

Japanese craftsmanship has always been well respected in the handcrafted leather industry especially with the craft of hemming and stitching. This is because it is their way of life as they commit themselves as artisans and continuously improve on their crafting skills.

Belt Kurenai and Siru involves the edge sealing process.

Leather edge sealing refers to the process of creating a sealed smooth edge along the exposed seams. Several steps include sanding, coating, burnishing and finally, buffing. These procedures will be repeated until the edge appears smooth and delicate.

It is the attention to details which the Japanese craftsmen pride themselves on. Their handmade products, especially, are well sought after as the consumers know for a fact that a certain standard will be delivered through the heart and soul of the artisan. Therefore, from the craftsman's skills, it can be said that a kind of unspeakable "life" is produced by the interaction between craftsman and material when making objects. Leading some to believe that hand-made objects in Japan, in addition to their form and function, are believed to have a “soul”.

In Japanese craftsmanship, they believe that through repeated polishing, it brings life into the product. This is something that cannot be replaced with machine processes. Wax is manually applied repeatedly to seal the edges of the leather strap. Not only will it create a polished look of the leather, it prolongs the life of the strap as well. As compared to applying glue, wax will not only reduce the chance of the leather splitting sooner, but it also protects the leather by creating a layer over it.

The colour of the leather will change over time due to interaction with the environment and body oil, giving it a personalised and unique touch. However, with the layers of wax skillfully applied over the leather, the core material will not be damaged. Sharing the same concept of Wabi-Sabi, as with the bronze case that we provide.

We provide the sewing and bulging for both belt Kurenai and belt Siru.

In addition, the saddle-stitching method will be used. It involves sewing with needles and threads which creates two rows of stitching in one single row of holes, and this process can only be achieved through skilled craftsmanship.

By adopting this method of handmade stitching instead of machine stitching, it ensures that the leather strap can last much longer as two independent threads are being used. If a thread breaks, the saddle stitch will still hold the leather together.

As for belt Kurenai and belt Siru, the suture of the strap is being hand sewn using Japanese hemp thread and finally sealing it off with beeswax. By doing so, the stitching sections are independent of each other, causing no overlaps thus ensuring a cleaner look while protecting the core of the strap.

kurenai

Thicker leather and added materials will be used to fill the centre of the strap, giving it a three-dimensional look, enhancing its aesthetics, and most importantly making it more comfortable on the user.

there are 2 Tochigi Leather straps to choose from.

kurenai: Lightweight design fit for daily wear

 Siru：hypoallergenic leather strap for sensitive skin.

 You have an option to engrave on the Tochigi leather strap and on the case back of the watch.

We genuinely want the watch to accompany you through your adventures whilst capturing the changes of ages and your fond memories.  

The bronze and Tochigi leather, therefore, is adopted.

Bronze acquires a stable oxidized layer that protects its structural integrity and hardness and gives it a unique look, patina, as the years go by. It is this stability that made bronze so appealing, and why it was favoured on our dive watch H1 and the like.

The Tochigi leather further encapsulates our stance of quality and pursuit of aesthetics. Being made solely from natural vegetable tannin, the Tochigi leather takes three months to be produced. When the highest quality leather sits on your wrist, you will immediately notice a high level of comfort and elasticity that come from generations of workmanship. With frequent wear, the leather will be softer and be “moulded” to the shape of your wrist.

As with the bronze case, the texture and tone of the leather changes over time, developing a sense of age unique to any individual.

Our ideals align with the Japanese quote ‘WABI-SABI’.

It means to appreciate the ‘Inner-Beauty’ of changes and we strongly believe that the H1 will hold greater meaning and appreciation to you.

With years of exposure in the supply chain for watches and timepieces, we have developed a high level of trust with the production and material suppliers line. With this relationship, we are able to secure preferential production scheduling and premium materials at a reasonable price.

As this will be the first product really belonged to us to be launched, we will be giving an early-bird special for adopters during our crowdfunding stage. You will be able to get your H1 at our cost price. 

We named our first watch “H1” as a tribute to John Harrison, one of BBC’s top 100 most influential people in the United Kingdom.

It took Harrison nearly 50 years to continuously perfect his invention and solved one of the greatest technological challenges of his time, to accurately calculate the longitude while at sea. As Dava Sobel, his biographer rightly puts it “he accomplished what Newton had feared was impossible: he invented a clock that would carry the true time from the home port, like an eternal flame, to any remote corner of the world.”

The design engraved on the back case of our watch is in fact the prototype of “H1”. It is the most representative work of navigation clock. Not only did it have the most accurate performance of its time, it is also representative of unremitting research, which greatly promoted the pursuit of watch making technology in that era and lifted the industry’s standard. It has withstood the test of time and is undoubtedly consistent with our pursuit of the inner ultimate perfection（下を律儀に）.

story:
Style Is Serene (S.I.S.) Clothing

Style Is Serene. What is style to you? Style can be funky. Your style can be sophisticated. S.I.S. Clothing is all about what style is to you and what it has the capacity to transform into. 

Ask yourself:

  • What does style mean to me? 
  • Does my style express who I am as a person?
  • What could my style be in the future?

S.I.S. Clothing wants you to be inspired by what you wear and let your outfits give you the drive needed to accomplish the things you care about. We just need a little bit of help from you first. 

What We Need & What You Get

Style Is Serene is expanding and wants to build a new image of itself. The money

donated will go towards:

  • High quality textiles and fabrics to create the very best pieces for you
  • Advertising to increase brand awareness to teach more people how to discover their own special style and spread the message
  • Manufacturing to keep costs low in order to appeal to more of our fans and keep your wallet happy!
For certain donations, you can receive anything from an assortment of our merchandise. 

The Impact

With the $1,500, Style Is Serene will be able to accommodate all of our customer's needs for quality clothing and better pricing. We will put our heart into making new designs and patterns using creative textiles and unique fabrics to create the best clothing possible, just for you. Help us to reach our goal & we will strive to make you the happiest customer alive!

(Designer & Owner-Gregory Richards on right)
For years now, it has been Greg's dream to make his clothing line successful. He's put the hard work in already: the pattern-making, the design, & the execution. Now, he just needs the funds for S.I.S. to really take off! S.I.S. has been alive since Greg's high school days, but it has been missing something to appeal to the mass market. After tolling research, we believe we finally know what you guys want: better quality and more innovative design. For too long, we have been succumbing to trends and following blindly just to "fit" in. Now, it's time to let our creative juices flow and we can't wait to get started.
 Can you?!

Why You Should Donate

  • S.I.S. is based in celebrating one's individuality because everyone's a little bit different and that's what makes the world wonderful & progressive
  • You benefit directly by gaining access to the soon-to-be highest quality streetwear merchandise
  • You'll be honorary  V.I.P.s of Style Is Serene and receive special discounts not available to the general public
  • The perks you will receive are awesome! Tons of merchandise up for grabs!

Risks & Challenges

Gregory Richards, owner & designer of Style Is Serene, has suffered from sickle cell anemia all his life. Sporadic hospital visits, uncontrollable spurts of pain, copious amounts of painkillers, this is his daily life. Just this past year, he has been hospitalized 3 times for months at a time. But he doesn't let his disease stop him from living. Even while he lays in bed, he toils away at new designs, makes edits to his webpage, and just never stops working. 

And for good reason, S.I.S. Clothing has a long way to go before it becomes something big. We need all the help we can get. 

Donate to ensure that all the hard work the SI.S. team has put into the brand doesn't go unnoticed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, please spread the word about our cause

  • Share on FB, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, etc!
  • Tell your friends by email or in person!
  • Ask about our brand ambassador program! (Get free clothes in return for wearing them to high caliber events and telling everyone where you got it)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello, my name is Sandra Marie Lund Olsen. Since a very young age I've dreamed of going into the fashion industry, but I was thinking more along the lines of high fashion dresses, expensive coats, and runway worthy apparel. It finally came to me, I didn't just want to make clothes, I wanted to send a message, to combine my thoughts of what was going on in this world, and also design. So I came up with Coexist, my very first piece. 
I strongly believe in Coexisting, I believe in LGBTQ rights, and I believe in getting along no matter what religion you believe in or what god you worship. So I made this design, with my love for fashion and my love standing up for what I believe in. 
Not only will your contributions help me to start my clothing line, but it will help get this message out in a fun way. Ill start off with a shirt, then ill move to a sweatshirt, and possibly sweatpants. Your contribution will help me continue to make products similar to this, products with a strong message. And anything you can give will be greatly appreciated. 


What We Need & What You Get

Let me break this down for you :)

  • Ill need $700 hundred dollars to get this started, to print all the shirts out and have them sent to me, and for shipping too. Ill sell each shirt at $25 a piece, and with the money I get ill need to pay the person who perfected my design (made every line straighter, made everything look perfect.) 
  • I have some pretty fun perks, $20 for a letter from me, and I promise I will make it a long letter too ;) $25 for a T-shirt :), A white shirt or a black shirt, your pick.  $50 for a letter and a shirt! It just gets better and better :) There are not many of the perks, so get them while you can! 
  • The funds will go to making the shirts and continuing to build this clothing line :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute there is another way you can help me! Please share this! Share this on every social media you have! 

Thats all folks! :)

story:
The idea & mission:

I am Martin, a 23 year old Latvian student in the UK. NinetyTwo watches is my try in successful business and its  main idea is to create a new type of class, using refined designs together with slim watch bodies and quality Swiss movements. As well as targeting at the Eco style with the bamboo watches, I've decided to go the more classic route to offer people quality watches for a decent price, to deliver the best value for your money and give you the style you want for any occasion. Even though the watch industry is quite saturated, there's always place for some innovation in design and quality put together, so I truly believe I can do this.

The unique 92 dial design delivers the message quite clearly - the watches are styled in a classic way with the small unique bit that makes them special.

The materials:

Made from 316L Surgery grade stainless steel, and using high grade plating technology, the watches will be durable and look gorgeous at any time. Sapphire glass is nearly impossible to scratch and is used by most watchmakers nowadays. The crystal clear glass delivers outrageously good view on the dial to make sure you always see the time when you need it the most, as well as the gorgeous 92 dial design.

Swiss made movement is precise and steady and has great reputation throughout the world. No wonder everyone knows about Swiss watches! Put together with the durable casing, it makes a perfect everyday watch.

The quite unique mesh type stainless steel strap is a design and functionality wonder to fit you perfectly without taking out any parts of the watch as it can strapped to your arm size.

The watches:

Built with the best materials, to deliver the best style to you. You choose your favourite and help me make it happen! The perks for getting the watches offer the greatest price the watches will ever have.

Some  of the first design visualizations are visible under this line if text:


The final (added on 20th of March) designs:

All of the designs for now, more to come eventually!

The watches look quite unique already, so to add the extra uniqueness bit, every single watch will be engraved with a unique serial number and will come together with a certificate to prove that you are the only person owning the gorgeous watch with exactly that serial number. To keep it all in control only 100 pieces of each watch will be made. Makes it even more desirable, huh? Extra uniqueness will be added with the Certificate of Authenticity for each watch, making sure you have the original NinetyTwo watch and no cheap copycat.

Sales & Marketing:

As advertising something classic is just as hard as advertising something unique, I will put all of my best effort to get this project rolling as good as I can. The huge webs of social networks is the best place where to look for fans and potential clients, so that's where I will focus in the beginning of this business.

I've done some research on what people like, which watches are the favourite, and I am getting a brief idea of which way to move the business for it to be successful once I've got the funding. Active Facebook and Twitter accounts is a key to deliver the message to as many people as I can, therefore I'm actively updating statuses all the time, to update NinetyTwo fans as much as I can, making the campaign and brand more visible to the whole world!

The Facebook page is already up and running, so is the Twitter profile and the webpage, found here, as follows:

http://www.ninetytwowatches.co.uk 


  http://www.facebook.com/NinetyTwoWatches

 http://www.twitter.com/92_Watches

Pre-order offers and other discount and offer option are also in my mind for future sales boosting and marketing.

Many of you might think "Why does this guy need ten thousand pounds to start it up?"...

Here's that part where I tell what the funding is needed for. As a part-time working Uni student it is obvious I don't have spare eight grand lying around my account, that' why the funds will be spent on this:

  • Making first physical samples. I guess you all noticed that the pictures are only design propositions derived from the manufacturer's pictures. That's because I am sharing an idea here and not so much promoting an actual product as most of projects. That's why I've put this up as flexible funding - the first funds will go directly to get physical samples, and therefore being able to show you guys the actual quality of the product.
  • Ordering first batches for each watch design. Only 100 watches will be available for each design to keep it unique for starters, I will order 5 designs, not including the bamboo Eco watches. To get the best quality watches I obviously can't take any cheap offers from manufacturers as they most likely won't last.
  • Advertising on social networks. Many people don't even realize how huge and expensive is the social network advertising campaign business. To reach out to the target audiences it is not anymore enough with some clicks on links and shares on Facebook, it requires greatly designed Ads and post boosts to target audiences.
  • Developing upcoming design series for the future. There's no use of making a new watch company to just make one batch of watches, that's why I'm looking towards the future and no-one's going to design new watches for free.
  • Shipping costs to early-bird watch buyers - obviously, I will need some sum to deliver the perks I offer to the people who want them, that's why the perks will only be delivered once a particular sum has been reached, in this case - 10% of the whole sum.
  • Up-keeping costs of the website, storage and moving around to deliver the goods to delivery companies.
  • Filming and photographing for the advertisements.And other small bits, which are still important to keep you guys entertained and up-to-date with what's going on with the project.



Future related stuff:

As I already explained above, this is not a one-time project, but something that I'm trying to build to last for a long time, to become a known name in the watch-lover community and to known for it's good quality and unique designs.

I already have loads of different ideas in my mind, and I will do everything that's needed to make it all happen. Most of my future plans have already been told in the text above, so I won't repeat myself. More design lines to be added in the process of the campaign rising, therefore remember to check back once in a while to see what great things have happened!

Thanks for looking at my idea, and I hope it did communicate with you in a good way! 

Even if you don't want to contribute financially, or simply just can't do that, you can still Like the Facebook page, follow on Twitter and visit the homepage once in a while to see what's going on with the project.



Risks and challenges

There's always risk in business and showing off something new - but that's what keeps me motivated to make it happen, the fact, that it is not always easy makes it a better challenge for me. 
The biggest obstacles will most likely be with selling and delivering goods. I am not saying there are no other obstacles possible, but most of them are so tiny, that I wouldn't even call them obstacles.


Funding:
Obviously, the risk with Flexible funding is that I could fail to meet the funding goal, therefore raising concerns in contributors who decide to buy the watches using the perks. Therefore I am now clarifying, that even if the goal is not met the watches WILL be delivered to the ones who want them, even if it will ask to sacrifice my own funds. I am here to boost a business and I know that care about my costumers is the key to being successful and known!

Sales:

With sales there's always a possibility that something could go wrong. Fortunately, as a Business Management student I have been taught, how to tackle tricky situations in the case of little amount of costumers and other problems. I've done enough market researches to understand, that my product will be quite unique and don't have any big competitors at this time. Attracting customers might be the hardest part of the "game", but as we all know, high quality, good name and active marketing will help out with that. And obviously - the product is the biggest advertisement there is.

Delivery: 
As there are many third-party obstacles, such as environmental problems, bad weather etc., not all of them may be controllable from my side, but if any of these arise, I will always look for any possible ways how to fix the occurred problems. 
Every delivery of the watches will be insured, making sure that both the buyer/receiver and the creator/seller are safe from potential theft or damage during the deliveries. Extra customs fees might occur, and most likely they should be tackled by the buyer, unfortunately. If anything like that occurs, please contact me immediately.

There is no problem one couldn't tackle with, therefore I am keeping a positive look at everything in life, and consider any obstacles as a new challenge for me to prove what I can do. I'll keep my fingers crossed everything works as it should and will do the most to tackle with all of it anyway.
story_txt:
The idea & mission:I am Martin, a 23 year old Latvian student in the UK. NinetyTwo watches is my try in successful business and its  main idea is to create a new type of class, using refined designs together with slim watch bodies and quality Swiss movements. As well as targeting at the Eco style with the bamboo watches, I've decided to go the more classic route to offer people quality watches for a decent price, to deliver the best value for your money and give you the style you want for any occasion. Even though the watch industry is quite saturated, there's always place for some innovation in design and quality put together, so I truly believe I can do this.The unique 92 dial design delivers the message quite clearly - the watches are styled in a classic way with the small unique bit that makes them special.The materials:Made from 316L Surgery grade stainless steel, and using high grade plating technology, the watches will be durable and look gorgeous at any time. Sapphire glass is nearly impossible to scratch and is used by most watchmakers nowadays. The crystal clear glass delivers outrageously good view on the dial to make sure you always see the time when you need it the most, as well as the gorgeous 92 dial design.Swiss made movement is precise and steady and has great reputation throughout the world. No wonder everyone knows about Swiss watches! Put together with the durable casing, it makes a perfect everyday watch.The quite unique mesh type stainless steel strap is a design and functionality wonder to fit you perfectly without taking out any parts of the watch as it can strapped to your arm size.

The watches:
Built with the best materials, to deliver the best style to you. You choose your favourite and help me make it happen! The perks for getting the watches offer the greatest price the watches will ever have.
Some  of the first design visualizations are visible under this line if text:





The final (added on 20th of March) designs:


All of the designs for now, more to come eventually!



The watches look quite unique already, so to add the extra uniqueness bit, every single watch will be engraved with a unique serial number and will come together with a certificate to prove that you are the only person owning the gorgeous watch with exactly that serial number. To keep it all in control only 100 pieces of each watch will be made. Makes it even more desirable, huh? Extra uniqueness will be added with the Certificate of Authenticity for each watch, making sure you have the original NinetyTwo watch and no cheap copycat.
Sales & Marketing:
As advertising something classic is just as hard as advertising something unique, I will put all of my best effort to get this project rolling as good as I can. The huge webs of social networks is the best place where to look for fans and potential clients, so that's where I will focus in the beginning of this business.
I've done some research on what people like, which watches are the favourite, and I am getting a brief idea of which way to move the business for it to be successful once I've got the funding. Active Facebook and Twitter accounts is a key to deliver the message to as many people as I can, therefore I'm actively updating statuses all the time, to update NinetyTwo fans as much as I can, making the campaign and brand more visible to the whole world!
The Facebook page is already up and running, so is the Twitter profile and the webpage, found here, as follows:
http://www.ninetytwowatches.co.uk 

  http://www.facebook.com/NinetyTwoWatches
 http://www.twitter.com/92_Watches
Pre-order offers and other discount and offer option are also in my mind for future sales boosting and marketing.

story:
Worum geht’s?

Taschen mit dem Logo des Blogs wolf auf tausend plateaus. Um die Drucken zu können, brauche ich eure Hilfe. Ziel sind 500€, ab dann erst lohnt sich der Gang zur Siebdruckwerkstatt.

10 gute Gründe die Taschen zu kaufen habe sind hier zusammengefasst.

Das Motiv

Miguel Jara hat im Frühjahr 2015 ein neues Logo für wolf auf tausend plateaus entworfen:


Weil das nicht nur online verdammt gut aussieht, soll es jetzt auch auf Taschen gedruckt werden. 

Die Perks

Du erhältst eine Gymbag im Format 46 x 36 cm in robuster, ungebleichter Baumwolle und einem Fassungsvermögen von 12 Litern. Für einen Aufpreis gibt es das Modell in schwarz. Der Aufpreis entsteht, weil auf dunklen Stoffen doppelt gesiebdruckt werden muss.

Zusätzlich gibt es Partner-Deals, wie bspw. 20 Ausgaben von Berliner Befindlichkeiten (Danke an Culturbooks!)

Der (gute) Zweck

Der Reinerlös geht in den Druck der bestellten Taschen. D.h, wenn die 500€ erreicht sind, werde ich Taschen im Wert von 500€ drucken lassen können - je mehr Geld zusammenkommt, desto mehr Taschen können gedruckt werden.

Die Perks werden bei einer sozialen Einrichtung in Berlin gedruckt. Die Union Sozialer Einrichtungen betreibt eine Werkstatt im Berliner Wedding, die hochwertigen Siebdruck anbietet. "Diejenigen, die eine geschützte Umgebung benötigen, finden in unseren Werkstätten einen Arbeitsplatz." Die USE machen tolle Arbeit mit tollen Menschen, die woanders in unserer Gesellschaft vielleicht keine Chance bekommen hätten. 

ACHTUNG: Damit sich der Druck lohnt, muss eine Mindestmenge erreicht werden. 

Der Erlös

Beim Abverkauf der zusätzlich gedruckten Taschen entsteht eine kleine Gewinnmarge, die für die laufenden Kosten (Server, Domain, etc.) des Blogs eingesetzt wird und für neue Investitionen (ein neues Logo, technische Updates, Layouts, Recherchen, usw.) genutzt wird. Der Kauf einer Tasche ist also automatisch auch eine Spende.

Das Blog

wolf auf tausend plateaus ist ein Blog zu aktueller Pop- und Subkultur. Fragen zu Zeitgeist und Geschmack werden zur Diskussion gestellt, Alltagsästhetik und Underground-Phänomene analysiert, Debatten ausgetragen und Kulturperlen geteilt.
